Sentencas: Here we report the influence of lithium doping on the electrical properties of NBT.
Titulo: Improvement of ionic conductivity in A-site lithium doped sodium bismuth titanate

Sentencas: The optimal doping level of 4 at% Li on the Bi-site improves the ionic conductivity by one order of magnitude to similar to 7 x 10(-3) S cm(-1) at 600 degrees C without changing the conduction mechanism, which could be attributed to an increase in the oxygen vacancy concentration based on an acceptor doping mechanism.

Sentencas: A further increase in Li content does not improve the total conductivity.

Sentencas: Oxygen diffusion data were acquired by the Isotope Exchange Depth Profile (IEDP) method in combination with Secondary Ion-Mass Spectrometry (SIMS).

Sentencas: The oxygen self-diffusion coefficients (e.g. 7.04 x 10(-9) cm(-2)s(-1) at 600 degrees C) are in excellent agreement with the values derived from impedance spectroscopy data, suggesting that the oxygen ions are the main charge carriers in the system.
Titulo: Improvement of ionic conductivity in A-site lithium doped sodium bismuth titanate

Sentencas: Furthermore, a degradation test was performed for 100 h under a variety of atmospheres, showing only a slight decrease in conductivity in both air and oxygen atmospheres attributed to the loss of material from the A-site.
